RESTful Web Services

Lesson
objectives

* Create a swagger schema to define an API

¢ Reference an existing Integration View in the
API

* Create an API handler class

¢ Publish an API

« Use swagger-ui to test an API

| What is the InsuranceSuite REST framework? Gi

¢ A framework for defining
RESTful web services

¢ Publishing only

* No client toolkit for
invoking APIs

¢ Design approach is
schema-first rather than
code-first

* Based on Swagger
schemas

« Not based on JAX-RS

Rest API Basics

Typical HTTP Verbs:

GET -> Read from Database

PUT -> Update/Replace row in Database
PATCH -> Update/Modify row in Database
POST -> Create a new record in the database
DELETE -> Delete from the database

Database

HTTP
GET
IS ee

HTTP POST

Oo
+ /newUser >
s
Ui HTTP.
PATCH
/updateUsey,

waAzm-rg

Rest API

Recieves HTTP
requests from
Clients and does
whatever request
needs. i.e create
users

—

Our Rest API queries the
database for what it needs

k

Our Clients, send HTTP Requests
and wait for responses

Response: When the Rest API has what it
needs, it sends back a response to the
clients. This would typically be in JSON
or XML format.

| REST framework components

* Swagger schema

* Swagger 2.0 schema definitions to define APIs
lew
¢ Integration View

« JSON Schema draft 4 to define the input/output schemas

* Can use the same schemas for integration views and/or
REST APIs

* Schema files drive request routing, validation, and
(de)serialization

+ Framework also handles standardized error codes and error
formats, localization, pluggable authentication, pluggable Ln
logging, content negotiation, etc

Swagger
Schema

Publish

External
Request

| Use case

Create an API that will allow external
resources to:

View a contact
View a list of contact notes
Update a contact

Add a note to a contact

Gi
Design approach

1. Define the API schema

* Create the Swagger schema for the
API paths and operations

2. Define the API Integration View

* Create an integration view for any
inputs and outputs

3. Define the API handler class

¢ Implement the API by creating a
handler class and its methods

4. Publish and test the API

e Ad it tn nithlichad sanic vam! filo

Define API schema

| Create a new yam file Gi

* Swagger schemas are written as yaml files
+ Placed in sub-directories of the config/integration/apis folder

* Swagger schemas can be defined in their own namespace within the apis folder, and can be nested in
arbitrary folders

+ Asa best practice, customer-specific Swagger schemas should be put into a customer-specific namespace:

+ apis/<company_code>/<product_code>

+ Swagger schemas must always have a version attached to their v integration
name, separated by a '-' character v apis
* The names should be formed as > gw.pl.framework

v trn.ta

conta wagger.yaml

* config/integration/apis/trn/ta/contact-1.0.swagger.yaml

+ <name>-<version>.swagger.yaml

¢ For example, for Training:

+ Swagger schema named trn.ta.contact-1.0 within the application

| Define header information

basePath

+ Determines where the resources are rooted on the REST servlet

REST servlet is defined in web.xml file with the default path rest

+ Becomes a prefix to each of the paths

+ The runtime path to the resources will

<scheme>://<server>:<port>/<webapp>/<servlet>/
<basePath>/<resource>

http://localhost:8880/ab/rest/trn/ta/contact/v1/<resource> (resources
are defined in paths)

InsuranceSuite extensions

+ Any declaration that starts with x-gw are custom InsuranceSuite
extensions to the schema, for example:

x-gw-schema-import

x-gw-apihandlers

:

swagger: '2.0'
info:

version: '1.0'

title: "Contact API"

description: "Contact API"
basePath: /trn/ta/contact/vl
x-gw-schema-import:

contact: trn.ta.contact-1.0
contactnote: trn.ta.contactnote-1.0
x-gw-apihandlers:
- trainingapp. restapi .ContactAPIHandler
produces:
- application/json
consumes:
- application/json
paths:

| Define get operation to view a contact anditsnotes [5

¢ HTTP GET requests are used to retrieve resource information only

/contacts/{contactId}:
get:
summary: "Retrieves a contact details”
operationId: getContact
x-gw-permissions:
~ abview
parameters:
- $ref: "#/parameters/contactId"
~ name: filter
in: query
type: string
enum: ["contact_details", "contactnote details")
responses:
"200":
description: "Contact details returned”
schema:
$ref: "contact#/definitions/ContactDetails”

WH

¥

¥.

v

parameters:
contactId:
name: contactId
in: path
type: string
required: true

| Define patch operation to update a contact Gi

¢ HTTP PATCH requests are used to make a partial update on a resource

¢ HTTP PUT requests are used to replace a resource in its entirety

14 Wd

patch:
summary: "Updates a contact"
operationId: updateContact
produces:
- text/plain
parameters:
- $ref: "#/parameters/contactId"
- name: body
in: body
required: true
schema:
$ref: "contact#/definitions/ContactUpdate"
responses:
*200':
description: "Contact was updated"
schema:
type: string

| Define post operation to add a note to a contact Gi

¢« HTTP POST requests are used to create new resources

LW

/contacts/{contactId} /note:
post:
summary: "Adds a note to a contact”
operationId: createContactifote
parameters:
- $ref: "#/parameters/contactIa"
~ name: body
in: body
required: true
schema:
$ref: "contactnote#/definitions/ContactNoteDetails”
responses:
"201":
description: "Note was added to the contact”

| Parameter validation constraints Gi

« Aresource may have a parameter in OED
their path, body, header and query

"/destinations/{destinationId}/retry":
post:

Depending on the type of parameter,
constraints can be specified to ensure
the request conforms to expected
schema definition

Apart from standard swagger schema
2.0 spec parameter options we also
support:

* x-gw-type for path, query and header
parameters

* The value of x-gw-type is an InsuranceSuite
typekey

summary: “Retry messages for a destination that had errors”
description: ""
operationid: retryHessages
x-gw-apihandler: gw.api.rest.pl.system.v10.MessagingToolsaPIHandler
parameters:
- ref: “#/parameters/destinationid™
-]name: category
jin: query
required: false

Itype: string
{x-gu-type:_typekey.ErrorCategory
parameters:
destinationId:
name: destinationid
in: path
description: “ID of the destination”
required: true
type: integer
format: _int32

| Integration Views and the REST API Gi

¢ API inputs and outputs can be associated with a

JSON schema definition and its corresponding > =
mapper file VE filters.trn.ta

= address_minimal-1.0.gql
& contact_details-1.0.gql
= contactnote_details-1.0.gql

* The JSON schema and mapping files in
InsuranceSuite are shared between the Integration

Views framework and the REST API framework mappingstinta

the same subset of json schema 4 contactnote-1.0.mapping,json

v tr.ta

| API handler class Gi

x-gv-apihandlers:

* Handler classes can be specified at the root level of ~ erainingapp.reevapt .ConcactAPTHandier
the document and overridden at the operation level y aepticarianrdaea
* The root document can provide a list of classes rather than « sppliasion seen
just one; they'll be considered in order 2 Jeontacts/(contactta)
get:
+ Handler classes need to have a no arguments, public constructor : anemone net Seteuist

deno.restapi .DemoContactAPIHandler

class Con

* Every operation defined for a published API must have an associated handler method

+ For each operation:

Framework will look for a public method with a name matching the operationld, for each candidate handler class
Declared methods are considered first, then all methods
There must be exactly one match

Method names cannot be overloaded

| Parameter binding

Each method parameter must match the name and
type of a parameter declared on the Swagger schema

* Order doesn’t matter

+ Don’t have to include all possible parameters

class Cont

function getContact(contactId : String,| fi

|: TransformResult {...}

Each parameter to the API handler method must either be:

+ A parameter declared on the Swagger schema for the associated
operation, or

* Of type gw.api.rest.RequestContext

Runtime operation parameter values can always be retrieved by name
from the RequestContext if they're not explicit arguments to the handler
method

Gi

paths:
/contacts/(contactId}:
get:

summary: "Retrieves a contact details"
x-gw-apihandlers:
~ deno. restapi .DenoContactAPIHandler
operationId: getContact
x-gw-permissions: <1 ites>

ters /contactId"

enum: ["contact details", "contactnote details")

| Return values Gi

* The API Handler method can return either
gw.api.rest.Response, void, or any type
that can be serialized out at runtime

function getContact (contactid : String, filter : String) :{TransformResult (...}

class ContactAPIHan

function updateContact (contactId : String, body : Jsondbjq Sering{...}

* Some common return types include: function «

actilove (contactId : String, body : Jsorpbject) : void (...}
* void

+ If the operation returns a 204 response code (no content), the method need not return anything at all
* TransformResult

+ An operation that produces JSON and/or XML and which uses an Integration Mapping to produce that data can
return a TransformResult directly

* String or byte]
+ Can return a String or byte[] that will be written out as-is.
+ Response

+ Can return a Response object that explicitly sets the response code, response body, and/or custom headers

Handler method to view a contact and its notes

function getContact(contactId : String, filter : String) : TransformResult (

var contact = findContactBylId(contactId)

+0", "ContactDetails")

var mappingOpts = new JsonMappingOptions ()
switch (filter) {
case "contact_details":
nappingOpts.withFilter("trn.ta.contact_details-1.0")
break
case "contactnote_details":
nappingOpts.withFilter("trn.ta.contactnote_details-1.0")
break
}
return jsonMapper.transformObject (contact, mappingOpts)
} else {
return jsonMapper.transformdbject (contact)
}
)

private function findContactByld(contactId : String) : ABContact {

var query0b} = Query.make(ABContact)

query0bj..compare (ABContact#PublicID, Relop. Equals, contactId)
var target0bj = query0bj.select() .AtMostOneRow

return target0bj

| Handler method to update a contact Gi

function updateContact(contactId : String, body : JsonObject) : String{
var contact = findContactById(contactId)
var contactUpdate = ContactUpdate.vrap(body)
Transaction. runW#ithNevBundle(\b -> {
contact = b.add(contact)

if (body.containsKey("dateOfBirth")) {
(contact as ABPerson) .DateOfBirth = contactUpdate.DateOfBirth

if (body. containsKey("driversLicenseNumber")) {
(contact as ABPerson).LicenseNumber = contactUpdate.DriversLicenselumber

if (body. containsKey("driversLicenseState")) {
(contact as ABPerson).LicenseState = contactUpdate.DriversLicenseState
}
»
return ("Contact " + contact.DisplayName + " was successfully updated")

| Handler method to create a contact note Gi

function c e(contactId : String, body : JsonObject) : void {
var contac! ‘indContactById (contactId)
var contactNote = ContactNoteDetails.vrap (body)
Transaction. runW#ithNewBundle(\b -> {
var newNote = new entity.ContactNote()
newNote.ContactNoteType = contactNote.ContactloteType
newNote.IsConfidential = contactNote.Confidential
newNote. Subject = contactNote.Subject
newNote.Body = contactNote.Body
contact.addToContactNotes (newNote)

* The newNote entity instance (ContactNote) is added to the contact read-only
entity instance (ABContact) by a foreign key field on newNote itself

¢ Therefore, the read-only contact entity instance does not need to be added to or
committed in the bundle

| Deploy code changes Gi

¢ New Gosu class * Modified Gosu Class

| API publishing

Schema files do not turn into network endpoints by default —— "a

* Must opt-in APIs to control what is exposed on the network

.

°

published-apis.yaml

~ name: gw.pl.£f

jev_template-1.0

Files are added to config/integration/apis/published-apis.yaml

Extension model

* Customers extend the core API and publish their
extended version, not the core one

« Multiple live versions can be published, all based
on core version

The default API URL returns a list of APIs
that have been published

* http://localhost:8880/ab/rest/apis

ic}

| swagger-ui

« InsuranceSuite bundles a swagger-ui distribution
+ Default URL is <base servlet url>/resources/swagger-ui/
+ http://localhost:8880/ab/resources/swagger-ui
¢ Every API automatically gets a /swagger.json endpoint
+ The serviet by default exists at /rest
+ Returns the default external view of the schema
¢ In swagger-ui manually change the endpoint to reference the desired API
+ <basePath>/swagger.json

+ The basePath declared in the schema is prepended to every path in the schema

{+ swagger http:/localhost:8880/ab/rest/trn/ta/contact/v1/swagger.json

Question G

7~ — Match the HTTP verb with its description

7
¢

[verb answer Description

if

| PUT Delete from the database

| RETRIEVE Update/Replace row in the database
I GET Create a new record in the database
| PATCH Read from the database

| INSERT Update/Modify row in the database

1 REMOVE Not an HTTP verb

' POST Not an HTTP verb

' REPLACE Not an HTTP verb

1

|||

DELETE Not an HTTP verb

Answer Gi

_- — Match the HTTP verb with its description

7
¢

Sve [answer Description

f

| PUT Update/Replace row in the database Delete from the database

| RETRIEVE Not an HTTP verb Update/Replace row in the database
I GET Read from the database Create a new record in the database
| PATCH Update/Modify row in the database Read from the database

| INSERT Not an HTTP verb Update/Modify row in the database

| REMOVE Not an HTTP verb Not an HTTP verb

i] POST Create a new record in the database Not an HTTP verb

| REPLACE Not an HTTP verb Not an HTTP verb

! DELETE Delete from the database Not an HTTP verb

| API handler class Gi

x-gv-apihandlers:

* Handler classes can be specified at the root level of ~ erainingapp.reevapt .ConcactAPTHandier
the document and overridden at the operation level y aepticarianrdaea
* The root document can provide a list of classes rather than « sppliasion seen
just one; they'll be considered in order 2 Jeontacts/(contactta)

+ Handler classes need to have a no arguments, public constructor : anemone net Seteuist

deno.restapi .DemoContactAPIHandler

class Con

* Every operation defined for a published API must have an associated handler method

+ For each operation:

Framework will look for a public method with a name matching the operationld, for each candidate handler class
Declared methods are considered first, then all methods
There must be exactly one match

Method names cannot be overloaded

| Parameter binding

Each method parameter must match the name and
type of a parameter declared on the Swagger schema

* Order doesn’t matter

+ Don’t have to include all possible parameters

class Cont

function getContact(contactId : String,| fi

|: TransformResult {...}

Each parameter to the API handler method must either be:

+ A parameter declared on the Swagger schema for the associated
operation, or

* Of type gw.api.rest.RequestContext

Runtime operation parameter values can always be retrieved by name
from the RequestContext if they're not explicit arguments to the handler
method

Gi

paths:
/contacts/(contactId}:
get:

summary: "Retrieves a contact details"
x-gw-apihandlers:
~ deno. restapi .DenoContactAPIHandler
operationId: getContact
x-gw-permissions: <1 ites>

ters /contactId"

enum: ["contact details", "contactnote details")

| Return values Gi

* The API Handler method can return either
gw.api.rest.Response, void, or any type
that can be serialized out at runtime

function getContact (contactid : String, filter : String) :{TransformResult (...}

class ContactAPIHan

function updateContact (contactId : String, body : Jsondbjq Sering{...}

* Some common return types include: function «

actilove (contactId : String, body : Jsorpbject) : void (...}
* void

+ If the operation returns a 204 response code (no content), the method need not return anything at all
* TransformResult

+ An operation that produces JSON and/or XML and which uses an Integration Mapping to produce that data can
return a TransformResult directly

* String or byte]
+ Can return a String or byte[] that will be written out as-is.
+ Response

+ Can return a Response object that explicitly sets the response code, response body, and/or custom headers

| swagger-ui

« InsuranceSuite bundles a swagger-ui distribution
+ Default URL is <base servlet url>/resources/swagger-ui/
+ http://localhost:8880/ab/resources/swagger-ui
¢ Every API automatically gets a /swagger.json endpoint
+ The serviet by default exists at /rest
+ Returns the default external view of the schema
¢ In swagger-ui manually change the endpoint to reference the desired API
+ <basePath>/swagger.json

+ The basePath declared in the schema is prepended to every path in the schema
